TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , from ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . The applicant is an employee of an oil production company , P. ( referred to below as “ the company ” ) , partly owned by ORG , with places of business all over GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE a large number of employees of the company , including the applicant , brought civil actions before the domestic courts requesting that they be granted certain salary benefits provided for in the general collective labour agreement for the oil industry . The requested benefits were a salary supplement for DATE supplies and/or a lump sum equal to the value of a specific quota of natural gas .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s action was rejected by a final decision of ORG delivered on DATE , which found , on the basis of an expert report , that the requested salary benefits had already been included in the applicant ’s basic salary .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE and DATE final judgments by courts of appeal found against most of the employees on the same grounds .
However , some employees were granted the requested benefits , as courts found that they had not received them as part of their basic salary .
CARDINAL . The collective labour agreement for the energy , oil and gas industry produced by ORG , ORG and ORG entered into force on DATE . The relevant parts of the agreement read as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) On the occasion of certain annual events such as GPE , DATE , DATE , as well as in DATE ( for DATE supplies ) , employees can benefit from a supplement to their salaries , in the form of an additional fixed amount ...
( CARDINAL ) The conditions and criteria for awarding such benefits shall be established in collective labour agreements concluded at company level . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) The employees of the companies listed in annex no.CARDINAL , point B , shall receive DATE a lump sum equal to the value of a specific quota of natural gas .

( CARDINAL ) The employees listed in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) , as well as the employees of the companies acting in the oil industry listed in annex no.CARDINAL , shall have the same right , unless they have received the benefit in the form of an increase in their basic salary . ”
